availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Chartered in 1850 by the Kentucky and Tennessee legislatures. Completed and traveled on November 1, 1859. Kentuckian James Guthrie served as president of the railroad. He initially allowed supplies to be sent to the Confederate Army. However, after the trade ban on the Confederacy, the railroad served the Union. Throughout the war, Union and Confederate forces in Kentucky and Tennessee attempted to control the line in order to move troops and supplies.

bibl.p: Russell Wigginton, "Louisville and Nashville Railroad," in The Tennessee Encyclopedia of History and Culture ed. Carroll Van West (Nashville: Rutledge Hill Press, 2002).
Charles B. Castner, "A Brief History of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad," http://www.lnrr.org/History.aspx accessed 03/14/2017.
